ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: How to iterate over many weeks to develop a sophisticated and complex design project.

Built on previous knowledge of design, this time with a focus on identity systems and flexible identities in general. It was great to get feedback on our design thinking and methods behind creating our projects in addition to the formal qualities of the work we presented.
I learned how to create a story around my work through different types of narrative sequences.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Strengths: Henk is terrific. The projects are tried and true. There is a feeling of trust that Henk has in his students which I found to be energizing and freeing.

Strengths: I loved this class. Since we get to pick the topic for each project, it's easy to get really passionate about what we're designing and that shows in the work of every student. The feedback we get is clear, sharp, and truly helps us grow as designers and as thinkers. 
Weaknesses: I don't think this class really has any weaknesses. The work you put in correlates to how much engagement you get out of it, and most people work hard.

Strengths: length of projects is perfect for thorough investigation of the work
Weaknesses: critics were sometimes not productive, didn't provide workable advice

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Mix of seminar and one-on-one meetings created a healthy balance.

I think of all art courses, this course was easier to convert to a virtual format, so besides the loss of in-person critiques (and the class bonding that comes along with it), I thought that I didn't miss out on much when it came to learning and personal development. Occasionally we'd have technical difficulties with screen sharing, but those were minor and forgivable given the pandemic.
Individual zoom meetings in place of 4 hour long crits to reduce zoom fatigue

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Definitely. I took the full GD sequence and this was my favorite by far. It was my first course with Henk and he's my favorite critic in the department. He really trusts you and treats you like an adult. I'm very proud of the work I made (and the work my peers made!) and I'm going to remember a lot of what I learned.

I would wholeheartedly recommend this class to another student! Especially for people who've been through the first steps of the design sequence, this class is a must-take. Henk is one of the best professors I have ever had at Yale, and in the art department, and getting to learn from him is truly precious.
Yes! I had the most freedom I've ever had in a design course to create what I was interested in, and dive deep into those interests.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
